forecast.name: Tonight

weather_report:
This early morning in Boston greets us with a serene clarity, the kind that brushes away the remnants of last night’s chill and invites a deep breath of freshness. The sky unfurls a vibrant blue, unmarred by the fog that sometimes cloaks this storied city, revealing a view that beckons one to venture outside. As the sun climbs, it will bid the frigid night adieu, warming the day to a comfortable peak around 33 degrees. A gentle westerly breeze whispers through, stirring the leaves and lifting spirits, though the evening promises to retreat into the depths of cold again, dipping down to a brisk 14 degrees.

It is a day made for quiet adventures—a brisk stroll through the Commons or perhaps a leisurely visit to a favorite café, where steaming mugs of coffee will ward off the chill. Dress in layers; a sturdy coat paired with a stylish scarf can offer both warmth and flair. As shadows stretch beneath the trees and the golden light of the late afternoon washes over the streets, consider indulging in simple joys: perhaps a visit to an art gallery or just a moment to sit outside and feel the thawing sun. The day holds promise—embrace it with an open heart and a curious mind.
